title: Many policemen burdened by debt
text:
11 PM Many policemen burdened by debt 
DUNGUN: Many policemen in the country have serious debt problems, says the department's deputy director of management (training) DCP Datuk T. Narenasagaran. 
He said many policemen – including officers – were in this situation as they had taken loans which they had difficulty repaying. 
He said some had monthly loan repayments amounting to 40% of their salary, which made it hard for them to make ends meet. 
"We should not easily give in to demands by family members if we cannot afford it," he told reporters after a training parade for 199 police constables at the Police Training Centre here Saturday. 
He said policemen were required to get their superiors' approval before applying for loans, with repayments deducted from their salaries and stated in their salary slips. 
He said the problem arose when they made loans without knowledge of their superiors. 
In his speech, Narenasagaran advised police trainees to embrace the concept of lifelong learning to improve themselves and become capable and dedicated policemen with integrity. – Bernama
